pr_title: [2184] Add hot storage for StateRoot to SlotAndBlockRoot

timeline.message:
Add hot storage for StateRoot to SlotAndBlockRoot

 - added serializer

 - added tests for serializer and database functions

 - this is not currently populated, though tests show the behavior of adding and pruning the list, as well as object retrieval.

partially addresses #2184

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText:
This doesn't feel right - I'd have expected new hot state roots to be added as part of aStorageUpdate event since they'll only be added as part of importing a block and thus should be stored in the same transaction as the rest of the updates.
In any case, we definitely wouldn't want to store them one at a time - it's much more efficient to store them in a batch.
Ultimately though this doesn't affect the disk layout so we could start with this to make these tests work then move to something else in later PRs when we're actually capturing the data during state transition.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: yep agreed, this shows store, purge, retrieve, and we can work out the messy details once we actually start storing data I guess.
replies.author: rolfyone

timeline.bodyText: If it becomes time consuming or difficult to support state roots on v3 databases we can skip it and only do it for v4/5.  Nothing critical depends on the lookup so it's reasonable for new features to only be available in the most recent database format.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText: all good, currently its identical code...
